children.brief: thrust::random is the namespace which contains random number engine class templates, random number engine adaptor class templates, engines with predefined parameters, and random number distribution class templates. They are provided in a separate namespace for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust namespace for easy access.

A discard_block_engine adapts an existing base random number engine and produces random values by discarding some of the values returned by its base engine. Each cycle of the compound engine begins by returning r values successively produced by the base engine and ends by discarding p-r such values. The engine's state is the state of its base engine followed by the number of calls to operator() that have occurred since the beginning of the current cycle.
children.name: thrust::random::discard_block_engine
children.summary: A discard_block_engine adapts an existing base random number engine and produces random values by discarding some of the values returned by its base engine. Each cycle of the compound engine begins by returning r values successively produced by the base engine and ends by discarding p-r such values. The engine's state is the state of its base engine followed by the number of calls to operator() that have occurred since the beginning of the current cycle.
children.title: thrust::random::discard_block_engine

children.brief: A linear_congruential_engine random number engine produces unsigned integer random numbers using a linear congruential random number generation algorithm.
children.name: thrust::random::linear_congruential_engine
children.summary: A linear_congruential_engine random number engine produces unsigned integer random numbers using a linear congruential random number generation algorithm.
children.title: thrust::random::linear_congruential_engine

children.brief: A linear_feedback_shift_engine random number engine produces unsigned integer random values using a linear feedback shift random number generation algorithm.
children.name: thrust::random::linear_feedback_shift_engine
children.summary: A linear_feedback_shift_engine random number engine produces unsigned integer random values using a linear feedback shift random number generation algorithm.
children.title: thrust::random::linear_feedback_shift_engine

children.brief: A normal_distribution random number distribution produces floating point Normally distributed random numbers.
children.name: thrust::random::normal_distribution
children.summary: A normal_distribution random number distribution produces floating point Normally distributed random numbers.
children.title: thrust::random::normal_distribution

children.brief: A subtract_with_carry_engine random number engine produces unsigned integer random numbers using the subtract with carry algorithm of Marsaglia & Zaman.
children.name: thrust::random::subtract_with_carry_engine
children.summary: A subtract_with_carry_engine random number engine produces unsigned integer random numbers using the subtract with carry algorithm of Marsaglia & Zaman.
children.title: thrust::random::subtract_with_carry_engine

children.brief: A uniform_int_distribution random number distribution produces signed or unsigned integer uniform random numbers from a given range.
children.name: thrust::random::uniform_int_distribution
children.summary: A uniform_int_distribution random number distribution produces signed or unsigned integer uniform random numbers from a given range.
children.title: thrust::random::uniform_int_distribution

children.brief: A uniform_real_distribution random number distribution produces floating point uniform random numbers from a half-open interval.
children.name: thrust::random::uniform_real_distribution
children.summary: A uniform_real_distribution random number distribution produces floating point uniform random numbers from a half-open interval.
children.title: thrust::random::uniform_real_distribution

children.brief: An xor_combine_engine adapts two existing base random number engines and produces random values by combining the values produced by each.
children.name: thrust::random::xor_combine_engine
children.summary: An xor_combine_engine adapts two existing base random number engines and produces random values by combining the values produced by each.
children.title: thrust::random::xor_combine_engine

children.brief: thrust::system is the namespace which contains specific Thrust backend systems. It also contains functionality for reporting error conditions originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces such as the CUDA runtime. They are provided in a separate namespace for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust namespace for easy access.

thrust::system::cuda is the namespace containing functionality for allocating, manipulating, and deallocating memory available to Thrust's CUDA backend system. The identifiers are provided in a separate namespace underneath thrust::system for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust::cuda namespace for easy access.
children.name: thrust::system::cuda
children.summary: thrust::system::cuda is the namespace containing functionality for allocating, manipulating, and deallocating memory available to Thrust's CUDA backend system. The identifiers are provided in a separate namespace underneath thrust::system for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust::cuda namespace for easy access.
children.title: thrust::system::cuda

children.brief: The class error_category serves as a base class for types used to identify the source and encoding of a particular category of error code. Classes may be derived from error_category to support categories of errors in addition to those defined in the C++ International Standard.
children.name: thrust::system::error_category
children.summary: The class error_category serves as a base class for types used to identify the source and encoding of a particular category of error code. Classes may be derived from error_category to support categories of errors in addition to those defined in the C++ International Standard.
children.title: thrust::system::error_category

children.brief: The class error_code describes an object used to hold error code values, such as those originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
children.name: thrust::system::error_code
children.summary: The class error_code describes an object used to hold error code values, such as those originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
children.title: thrust::system::error_code

children.brief: The class error_condition describes an object used to hold values identifying error conditions.
children.name: thrust::system::error_condition
children.summary: The class error_condition describes an object used to hold values identifying error conditions.
children.title: thrust::system::error_condition

children.brief: The class system_error describes an exception object used to report error conditions that have an associated error_code. Such error conditions typically originate from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
children.name: thrust::system::system_error
children.summary: The class system_error describes an exception object used to report error conditions that have an associated error_code. Such error conditions typically originate from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
children.title: thrust::system::system_error

children.brief: tuple is a class template that can be instantiated with up to ten arguments. Each template argument specifies the type of element in the tuple. Consequently, tuples are heterogeneous, fixed-size collections of values. An instantiation of tuple with two arguments is similar to an instantiation of pair with the same two arguments. Individual elements of a tuple may be accessed with the get function.
children.name: thrust::tuple
children.summary: tuple is a class template that can be instantiated with up to ten arguments. Each template argument specifies the type of element in the tuple. Consequently, tuples are heterogeneous, fixed-size collections of values. An instantiation of tuple with two arguments is similar to an instantiation of pair with the same two arguments. Individual elements of a tuple may be accessed with the get function.
children.title: thrust::tuple
